semantic_title: Principal Diagnosis for Birth Record Using Z38 Codes
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 16. Chapter 16: Certain Conditions Originating in the Perinatal Period > a. General Perinatal Rules > 2) Principal Diagnosis for Birth Record

content.full_text: When coding the birth episode in a newborn record, assign a code from category Z38, Liveborn infants according to place of birth and type of delivery, as the principal diagnosis. A code from category Z38 is assigned only once, to a newborn at the time of birth. If a newborn is transferred to another institution, a code from category Z38 should not be used at the receiving hospital. A code from category Z38 is used only on the newborn record, not on the mother's record. (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L84)
content.summary: Use Z38 codes as principal diagnosis for birth episodes, assigned only once at birth, not for transfers or on maternal records. (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L84)
key_concepts: Z38 as principal diagnosis for birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L80)
One-time assignment at birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L80-L81)
No use for transfers (Evidence: pg no: 70, L82-L83)
Newborn record only (Evidence: pg no: 70, L84)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Z38 code as principal diagnosis for birth episode (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: When coding the initial birth episode in a newborn record, a code from category Z38 must be assigned as the principal diagnosis to indicate the circumstances of birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z38 code assigned only once, at time of birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L80-L81)
detailed_rules.explanation: A Z38 code is used only once in a newborn's lifetime, specifically for the initial birth episode, and never for subsequent encounters (Evidence: pg no: 70, L80-L81)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not use Z38 at receiving hospital for transfers (Evidence: pg no: 70, L82-L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a newborn is transferred to another institution, the receiving hospital should not assign a Z38 code since it was already used at the birth facility (Evidence: pg no: 70, L82-L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z38 codes used only on newborn record, not mother's record (Evidence: pg no: 70, L84)
detailed_rules.explanation: Z38 codes are exclusively for newborn records and must never appear on the maternal record (Evidence: pg no: 70, L84)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify birth episode in newborn record
Step 2: Select appropriate Z38 code based on place and type of delivery
Step 3: Assign Z38 code as principal diagnosis
Step 4: Add additional diagnoses for any conditions
Step 5: Ensure Z38 is not used for transfers or on maternal record

code_ranges.description: Liveborn infants according to place of birth and type of delivery (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L80)
usage_rules: Assigned only once at birth (Evidence: pg no: 70, L80-L81)
Not used for transfers (Evidence: pg no: 70, L82-L83)
Newborn record only (Evidence: pg no: 70, L84)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Term newborn delivered vaginally in hospital
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Full-term male infant born via spontaneous vaginal delivery in hospital, no complications noted.

correct_coding.rationale: Z38 codes are assigned as principal diagnosis for birth episodes (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L80)

codes: Any non-Z38 code as principal for birth
incorrect_coding.rationale: Z38 must be principal for birth episodes
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using condition codes as principal instead of Z38

coding_scenarios.scenario: Newborn born at hospital A, transferred to hospital B for NICU care
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Newborn transferred from birth hospital to tertiary NICU for respiratory distress management.
step_by_step: Step 1: Hospital A uses Z38 for birth episode
Step 2: Hospital B does not use Z38
Step 3: Hospital B codes reason for transfer as principal
Step 4: Hospital B adds appropriate condition codes

correct_coding.primary_code: Hospital A: Z38.x, Hospital B: Condition code
correct_coding.sequencing: Z38 only at birth hospital, condition codes at receiving hospital
correct_coding.rationale: Z38 should not be used at receiving hospital for transfers (Evidence: pg no: 70, L82-L83)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Z38 is assigned only once, at birth
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using Z38 at receiving hospital for transfers

warnings: Never use Z38 codes for transfers to other institutions (Evidence: pg no: 70, L82-L83)
Z38 codes are never used on maternal records (Evidence: pg no: 70, L84)
best_practices: Always use Z38 as principal diagnosis for birth episodes (Evidence: pg no: 70, L79-L80)
Assign Z38 only once per newborn lifetime (Evidence: pg no: 70, L80-L81)
common_mistakes: Using Z38 at receiving hospitals for transfers
Using Z38 for subsequent newborn encounters
tips: Remember: Z38 = birth episode only, one time use
implementation_notes: Critical for proper birth documentation and statistics
clinical_context: Essential for tracking birth outcomes and newborn health
